questions.text: The Battle of Plassey (1757) was fought between:
questions.explanation: The Battle of Plassey established British dominance in India when Robert Clive defeated Siraj-ud-Daulah.

questions.text: Who among the following was the first Governor-General of India?
questions.explanation: Warren Hastings (1772-1785) was the first Governor-General of India.

questions.text: The Regulating Act of 1773 was passed by the British Parliament to:
options: Establish a Supreme Court in Calcutta
Regulate East India Company activities in India
questions.explanation: The Regulating Act of 1773 was the first major legislation to regulate East India Company's administration.

questions.text: The 'Permanent Settlement' of 1793 was introduced in Bengal by:
questions.explanation: Lord Cornwallis introduced the Permanent Settlement in Bengal (1793).

questions.text: Who was the leader of the Revolt of 1857 in Lucknow?
questions.explanation: Begum Hazrat Mahal led the Revolt of 1857 in Lucknow.

questions.text: The 'Doctrine of Lapse' was introduced by which Governor-General?
questions.explanation: Lord Dalhousie introduced the Doctrine of Lapse to annex territories without natural heirs.

questions.text: The Indian National Congress was founded in:
questions.explanation: The Indian National Congress was founded on December 28, 1885, by A.O. Hume.

questions.text: Who was the first President of the Indian National Congress?
questions.explanation: Womesh Chandra Banerjea was the first President of Indian National Congress (1885).

questions.text: The Swadeshi Movement gained momentum after:
questions.explanation: The Partition of Bengal (1905) by Lord Curzon sparked the Swadeshi Movement.

questions.text: The 'Home Rule Movement' in India was initiated by:
questions.explanation: The Home Rule Movement was initiated independently by both Annie Besant and Bal Gangadhar Tilak.

questions.text: Who founded the 'Brahmo Samaj'?
questions.explanation: Raja Ram Mohan Roy founded the Brahmo Samaj in 1828.

questions.text: The Young Bengal Movement was associated with:
questions.explanation: Henry Derozio led the Young Bengal Movement (1820s-1830s) promoting rationalism.

questions.text: The Cripps Mission came to India in:
questions.explanation: Sir Stafford Cripps came to India in March 1942 offering dominion status.

questions.text: Who among the following was the founder of the 'Theosophical Society'?
questions.explanation: Helena Blavatsky founded the Theosophical Society in 1875.

questions.text: The Vernacular Press Act was passed in:
questions.explanation: The Vernacular Press Act (1878) was enacted under Lord Lytton.

questions.text: The Civil Disobedience Movement was launched by Gandhi in:
questions.explanation: The Civil Disobedience Movement was launched on March 12, 1930, with the Salt March.

questions.text: The Non-Cooperation Movement was launched in:
questions.explanation: The Non-Cooperation Movement was launched on September 13, 1920.

questions.text: Who founded the 'Indian Home Rule Society' in London?
questions.explanation: Shyamji Krishna Varma founded the Indian Home Rule Society in London (1905).

questions.text: The Jallianwala Bagh massacre occurred in:
questions.explanation: The Jallianwala Bagh massacre occurred in Amritsar on April 13, 1919.

questions.text: The Khilafat Movement was initiated to:
questions.explanation: The Khilafat Movement was initiated to protect the Ottoman Caliphate after World War I.

questions.text: Who is known as the 'Father of the Indian National Army'?
questions.explanation: Subhas Chandra Bose reorganized the INA to fight for Indian independence.

questions.text: The 'Quit India Movement' was launched in:
questions.explanation: The Quit India Movement was launched on August 9, 1942.

questions.text: Who among the following was NOT part of the 'Triumvirate' of modern Indian Renaissance?
questions.explanation: Raja Ram Mohan Roy was an earlier reformer; the Triumvirate typically refers to later spiritual figures.

questions.text: The Congress-Khilafat Alliance was primarily between:
questions.explanation: The Congress-Khilafat Alliance represented Hindu-Muslim cooperation.

questions.text: Who authored 'Anandmath' which became the inspiration for 'Vande Mataram'?
questions.explanation: Bankimchandra Chatterjee authored 'Anandmath' (1882) containing 'Vande Mataram'.

questions.text: The 'Drain of Wealth' theory was propounded by:
questions.explanation: Dadabhai Naoroji propounded the 'Drain of Wealth' theory in 'Poverty and Un-British Rule in India'.

questions.text: Who is known as the 'Lion of Punjab'?
questions.explanation: Lala Lajpat Rai is known as the 'Lion of Punjab' (Sher-e-Punjab).

questions.text: The 'Ryotwari System' was introduced in:
questions.explanation: The Ryotwari System was introduced in the Madras Presidency by Thomas Munro.

questions.text: Who founded the 'Servants of India Society'?
questions.explanation: Gopal Krishna Gokhale founded the Servants of India Society (1905).

questions.text: The Chauri Chaura incident occurred in:
questions.explanation: The Chauri Chaura incident occurred on February 5, 1922, leading to the withdrawal of Non-Cooperation.

questions.text: Who organized the 'Kakori Conspiracy'?
questions.explanation: Ram Prasad Bismil organized the Kakori Conspiracy (1925).

questions.text: The Simon Commission visited India in:
questions.explanation: The Simon Commission visited India in 1927-1928.

questions.text: Who is known as 'Frontier Gandhi'?
questions.explanation: Khan Abdul Ghaffar Khan is known as 'Frontier Gandhi'.

questions.text: The Cabinet Mission Plan was presented in:
questions.explanation: The Cabinet Mission Plan (1946) proposed a federal structure for India.

questions.text: Who presided over the Constituent Assembly that drafted the Indian Constitution?
questions.explanation: Dr. Rajendra Prasad presided over the Constituent Assembly.

questions.text: The Indian Constitution was adopted on:
questions.explanation: The Constitution was adopted on November 26, 1949, and came into effect on Jan 26, 1950.

questions.text: Who among the following did NOT support the Partition of India?
questions.explanation: Mahatma Gandhi was deeply opposed to the Partition of India.

questions.text: The 'Namaste' gesture signifies:
options: The light in me greets the light in you
questions.explanation: Namaste spiritually signifies 'The light in me greets the light in you'.

questions.text: Who introduced the concept of 'Satyagraha'?
questions.explanation: Mahatma Gandhi introduced the concept of Satyagraha (truth-force).

questions.text: The 'Great Rebellion' of 1857 is also known as:
questions.explanation: It is known by all these names depending on the historical perspective.

questions.text: Who started the 'Brahmo Samaj' after Raja Ram Mohan Roy?
questions.explanation: Debendranath Tagore succeeded Raja Ram Mohan Roy in leading the Brahmo Samaj.

questions.text: The Arya Samaj was founded by:
questions.explanation: Dayanand Saraswati founded the Arya Samaj in 1875.

questions.text: Who was the first woman President of Indian National Congress?
questions.explanation: Annie Besant was the first woman President of INC (1917).

questions.text: The 'Moderate' phase of the Indian National Congress lasted till:
questions.explanation: The Moderate phase lasted until 1905, ending with the Partition of Bengal.

questions.text: Who is known for the concept of 'Two-Nation Theory'?
questions.explanation: Muhammad Ali Jinnah propounded the Two-Nation Theory.

questions.text: The 'Sepoy Mutiny' began at:
questions.explanation: The Sepoy Mutiny began at Meerut on May 10, 1857.

questions.text: Who was the first editor of 'The Hindu' newspaper?
questions.explanation: G. Subramania Iyer founded and was the first editor of 'The Hindu'.

questions.text: Rabindranath Tagore renounced his knighthood in protest against:
questions.explanation: Tagore renounced his knighthood after the Jallianwala Bagh massacre (1919).

questions.text: Who was the leader of the Moplah Rebellion?
questions.explanation: Ali Musaliar led the Moplah Rebellion (1921) in Kerala.

questions.text: India became independent on:
questions.explanation: India became independent on August 15, 1947.
